definition: (onom.) ting-a-ling (in compounds such as 玎玲 or 玲瓏|玲珑)/tinkling of gem-pendants

sentences.english: With kettle body, portable and novelty, fashionable and elegant.
sentences.chinese: 優美流線型壺體，小巧玲瓏，時尚大方，精緻典雅。

sentences.english: What's more, these compasses would be small and would consume very little energy.
sentences.chinese: 另外，這些新型羅盤將小巧玲瓏並且能耗極低。

sentences.english: The decorative case is dapper. The decorative case has perfect visual effects on treasuring articles.
sentences.chinese: 該裝飾盒小巧玲瓏，珍藏物品時有較好的直觀效果。

sentences.english: EVA mousepad is delicate and fragile , outward appearance is delicate , economy is pragmatic.
sentences.chinese: EVA鼠標墊小巧玲瓏，外觀秀氣，又經濟實用。

sentences.english: Like a little and dainty gold, in this season to meet the.
sentences.chinese: 猶如一片片小巧玲瓏的金箔，在此季迎接暮色的蒞臨。

definition: tender and beautiful/also written 嬌艷|娇艳
simple and neat/quiet (colors)/unobtrusive/(of food) light/not greasy or strongly flavored
loved by all/to have universal appeal
lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
